page.title: 03Housing in Elford
page.content: We did a survey on the houses in Elford.We discovered that there are 116 houses in the village.The largest group of 34 were all built 12 years ago.There are 35 that were built over a hundred years ago.There are lovely old black and white timbered cottages and restored old buildings.The following names refer to the history of the buildings or village.They are-: School,The School house,Paget House,The Stables,The Mill House,The Forge,The Black and White Cottage,Park Farm and Raddle Farm.Lichfield District Council have built several old people's flats and bungalows.I live at 1 Stubby Leas cottages in Fisherwick just out of Elford near an old people's Rest Home. There is a wood next to our house called the Fisherwick Wood.
